meanings.definition: To have enough money or resources to be able to buy or do something.
meanings.sent1: She could afford a new dress for the party.
meanings.sent2: I can't afford to go on vacation this year.
meanings.sent3: He afforded himself a treat after a long day at work.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to travel abroad afforded her a new perspective on life.
meanings.sent5: The generous discount afforded us the chance to buy the latest gadgets.

meanings.sent1: The hotel afforded a beautiful view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The scholarship afforded him the opportunity to attend college.
meanings.sent3: The kind gesture afforded her a sense of relief.
meanings.sent4: The umbrella afforded protection from the rain.
meanings.sent5: The library afforded a quiet place to study.

meanings.sent1: The company afforded him a promotion for his hard work.
meanings.sent2: The charity afforded assistance to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The teacher afforded extra help to struggling students.
meanings.sent4: The government afforded support to small businesses.
meanings.sent5: The program afforded participants the chance to learn new skills.
